main event: A large luminous object was sighted by a witness and three children while traveling on U.S. Route 60 from Covington, Virginia to White Sulphur Springs, West Virginia on November 11, 1957. The object appeared to change in color from orange to white and seemed to have an oscillating motion towards the ground before disappearing when the sun's reflection was no longer visible on the object.
interesting points: The object was described as a 'large luminous body' that changed in color from orange to white with a constant orange color at one end.
It had an oscillating motion towards the ground and appeared like a 'large fountain pen held horizontally at arm's length.'
The witness stated that there was no unusual noise associated with the object.
The sighting lasted for approximately 3 minutes, and the object disappeared without the direction of its course being known.
The weather conditions during the sighting included clear skies with no restrictions to visibility.
location: U.S. Route 60 from Covington, Virginia to White Sulphur Springs, West Virginia
witnesses: Superintendent of _______ __________ Age 42, General Agent, THOMAS G. REYNOLDS, and three children
